snippet: American Indians, citing possible injury to fishing rights and religious and sacred sites, have joined environmental groups and politicians in opposing a plan for six export terminals.
abstract: American Indian tribes have joined with environmental groups and politicians in opposing proposed coal export terminals in Pacific Northwest, citing possible injury to fishing rights and religious and sacred sites.
lead_paragraph: American Indians, citing possible injury to fishing rights and religious and sacred sites, have joined environmental groups and politicians in opposing a plan for six export terminals.

headline.seo: Tribes Add Powerful Voice Against Northwest Coal Plan
headline.main: Tribes Add Potent Voice Against Plan for Northwest Coal Terminals
headline.print_headline: Tribes Add Potent Voice Against Plan for Northwest Coal Terminals
